column4: UPDATE 1-Activision game crosses $1 bln in sales

column5: NEW YORK (TheWrap.com) - Predictions for the Kindle Fire have ranged from it being the iPad killer to its less expensive equal  but one thing the New York Times' David Streitfeld writes almost everyone can agree on -- it has some kinks to work out.

column5: CHICAGO Chicago pit traders are up in arms against a CME Group  plan to use electronic trading to set grain and livestock closing prices  a move they fear will drive another nail in the coffin of open-outcry dealing.

column4: Illinois House passes CME  Sears tax breaks
column5: The Illinois House on Monday passed a package of tax breaks for CME Group Inc and Sears Holdings Corp  sending the measure to the Senate for a final vote.

column4: CME won't guarantee remaining missing MFG funds: COO
column5: CHICAGO CME Group Chief Operating Officer Bryan Durkin said on Monday the exchange will not guarantee the funds that remain missing from customer accounts at bankrupt brokerage MF Global after they are reimbursed by the bankruptcy trustee.

column4: TIMELINE-Biglari takes a crack at Cracker Barrel

column4: Dish eyes T-Mobile if AT&T bid fails
column5: NEW YORK Dish Network Corp is considering a partnership with T-Mobile USA if AT&T is unable to fulfill its bid to take over the fourth U.S. wireless network  Dish Chief Executive Joe Clayton said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-FDA okays Endo's crush-resistant formulation of Opana
column5: Dec 12 Endo Pharmaceuticals Holdings Inc  said U.S. health regulators approved a new crush-resistant formulation of its pain drug Opana  sending the specialty drugmaker's shares up as much as 7 percent.

column4: KOGAS says Nov domestic gas sales down 8.9 pct y/y
column5: SEOUL  Dec 12 South Korea's state-run Korea Gas Corp (KOGAS) said on Monday it had sold gas equivalent to 2.708 million tonnes of liquefied natural gas (LNG) domestically in November  down 8.9 percent from a year earlier.

column4: Intel says sales hit by hard drive shortage
column5: Intel Corp warned that hard-disk drive supply shortages would hurt its current-quarter revenue  the latest heavyweight in the PC industry to caution about the effects of flooding that has crippled factories in Thailand.

column4: Urban Outfitters says retail comp sales up so far in holiday
column5: Apparel retailer Urban Outfitters Inc  said in regulatory filing that retail segment same-store sales were up in the mid-single digits so far in the fourth quarter  sending its shares up 10 percent after the bell.

column4: 3M pursues paint-less cars with new partnership
column5: 3M Co  has signed a five-year commercial pact with a relatively new stainless steel and aluminum distributor to create a stable of so-called disruptive products  including technology that could eliminate the need for paint on automobiles.

column4: UPDATE 1-Abbott pays $400 mln to extend drug deal with Reata
column5: Dec 12 Abbott Laboratories paid $400 million to privately held Reata Pharmaceuticals to gain access to its drug technology that may be used to treat multiple indications including pulmonary  neurological and immunological disorders.

column4: American Tower to buy towers for $500 million
column5: U.S. tower company American Tower Corp  said it will acquire up to 2 500 telecommunication towers from Spain-based Telefónica's  Mexican unit for roughly $500 million.

column4: UPDATE 1-American Tower to buy towers for $500 mln
column5: Dec 12 U.S. tower company American Tower Corp said it will acquire up to 2 500 telecommunication towers from Spain-based Telefónica's Mexican unit for roughly $500 million.

column4: KDB-led fund buys Apache gas assets for $200 mln -KDB
column5: SEOUL  Dec 12 A South Korean private equity fund led by Korea Development Bank (KDB) has acquired gas assets from U.S. oil and gas company Apache Corp for $200 million  KDB said on Monday.

column4: AT&T mulling whether  how to revise T-Mobile deal
column5: NEW YORK AT&T Inc has another month to decide whether it wants to continue to pursue its $39 billion acquisition of T-Mobile USA after a U.S. Judge agreed to delay the court battle over the deal until January 18.

column4: Judge grants stay in Justice Department  AT&T fight
column5: WASHINGTON Judge Ellen Huvelle  who is hearing the Justice Department's challenge of AT&T's buy of T-Mobile USA  granted the parties' joint motion for a stay.

column4: UPDATE 1-Axis Capital CEO to retire in 2012
column5: Dec 12 Axis Capital Holdings Ltd  said its Chief Executive John Charman will retire in May 2012  and will be replaced by finance chief Albert Benchimol.

column4: BofA Merrill  Tora to partner on new trading platform
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 12 Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Tora Trading are teaming up to launch a new trading platform aimed at fund managers in Asia  where finding liquidity in volatile market conditions is a major concern.

column4: Regulator says Canada's BCE must share mobile-phone sports
column5: TORONTO BCE Inc  Canada's largest telecom company and owner of its biggest private broadcaster  must make its sports content  including the Super Bowl telecast  available to rivals for distribution over mobile devices  a regulator said on Monday.

column5: Dec 12 Aircraft parts supplier Spirit Aerosystems Inc plans to increase production at all its facilities due to strong demand  and will shift production of some Boeing 787 Dreamliner components to Malaysia.

column5: Dec 12   * Spirit aerosystems to realign Boeing 787 dreamliner wing component production

column4: Boeing raises dividend by 5 percent
column5: Boeing   the world's largest aerospace and defense company  said its board of directors has approved a 5 percent increase to its quarterly dividend.

column4: UPDATE 1-Boeing raises dividend by 5 pct
column5: Dec 12 Boeing  the world's largest aerospace and defense company  said its board of directors has approved a 5 percent increase to its quarterly dividend.

column4: Manufacturers bracing for a slower-growth 2012
column5: As they head into 2012  the world's top multinational manufacturers are trying to find a safe route through an economy that is known more for the promise of volatility than for the prospect of surefire growth.

column4: Resources may spur Canadian M&A in 2012: CIBC
column5: TORONTO Cash-rich corporations and a stable economy will drive mergers and acquisitions in Canada in 2012  and lower commodity prices may spur opportunistic buying of resource companies  a top M&A expert at Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce  said in a report on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-CN Rail  union reach tentative deal
column5: Dec 12 Canadian National Railway Co  and Teamsters Canada Rail Conference (TCRC) have reached a tentative agreement on labor contracts before the expiry of the current contract.

column4: Caterpillar president -- replacement demand strong
column5: NEW YORK Caterpillar Group Inc  President Stu Levenick said on Monday the company is seeing "surprising" strength in replacement demand for machinery in developed markets and is confident Europe can still be a great market for the company despite near-term expectations for "pretty paltry" overall economic growth.

column4: U.S.-listed firms told to reveal Syria  Iran links: FT
column5: NEW YORK At least a dozen U.S.-listed companies have been told by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to disclose business activity in and with Syria  Iran and others deemed "state sponsors" of terror by the state department  the Financial Times said on Sunday.

column4: UPDATE 1-ConocoPhillips makes N.Sea gas find  tests needed
column5: OSLO  Dec 12 ConocoPhillips has made a gas find in the southern North Sea near BP's Ula oil and gas field  the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate said on Monday  but more tests are needed to see if the shallow-water discovery is worth developing.

column4: ConocoPhillips finds gas in North Sea  size unknown
column5: OSLO  Dec 12 Energy company ConocoPhillips  has discovered gas in a southern North Sea wildcat well some 19 kilometres south of BP's Ula field  the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate said on Monday.

column4: German carbon trial prosecutor urges long sentences
column5: FRANKFURT  Dec 12 A German prosecutor on Monday demanded jail terms of up to eight and a half years for six men on trial for fraud involving evasion of taxes on carbon permits  with a verdict possible as early as next week.

column4: Oil falls on euro zone worry  dollar strength
column5: NEW YORK Oil prices fell on Monday  pressured by concerns that Europe's agreement on closer fiscal union will not solve its debt crisis and might deepen a regional slowdown.

column4: Exxon Antwerp refinery talks fail  strike possible
column5: BRUSSELS  Dec 12 Pay talks between union leaders and management at Exxon Mobil Corp's refinery in the northern Belgian port city of Antwerp failed on Monday  reviving the possibility of a strike  a union official said.

column4: RPT-Freeport Indonesia union to extend strike to mid Jan
column5: JAKARTA  Dec 10 An Indonesian workers' union plans to extend a three-month strike at Freeport McMoRan Copper & Gold's Grasberg mine until Jan. 15  union official Virgo Solossa told Reuters on Saturday.

column4: GM suspends production at Cruze plant in Ohio
column5: General Motors Co suspended production on Monday afternoon at an Ohio plant that makes the Chevrolet Cruze compact car due to a supplier issue.

column4: UPDATE 2-GM suspends production at Cruze plant in Ohio
column5: Dec 12 General Motors Co suspended production on Monday afternoon at an Ohio plant that makes the Chevrolet Cruze compact car due to a supplier issue.

column4: UPDATE 1-Fondiaria names Goldman to advise on capital moves
column5: MILAN  Dec 12 Fondiaria-SAI SpA  Italy's largest motor insurer  named U.S. bank Goldman Sachs on Monday to advise on efforts to boost its weak capital base as worries over fresh fund-raising by the insurer weighed on its shares.

column4: Fondiaria-SA names Goldman Sachs adviser on capital measures
column5: MILAN  Dec 12 Fondiaria-SAI  Italy's largest motor insurer  said on Monday it had appointed Goldman Sachs as financial adviser on boosting its weak capital strength.

column4: MOVES-Goldman  Swiss Re  Barclays  Avoca
column5: Dec 12 The following financial service industry appointments were announced on Monday. To inform us of other job changes  email to moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: UPDATE 1-Goldman's Machin to retire from Asia post - memo
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 12 The Goldman Sachs Group Inc banker who was co-head of the firm's Asia investment banking operation for six years is retiring  according to an internal memo obtained by Reuters on Monday  the second senior Asia banker to depart Goldman in the last month.

column4: UPDATE 1-Buyout firm First Atlantic puts Prestolite on sale -sources
column5: * Mid-cap U.S. fund First Atlantic hires Goldman to advise on Prestolite sale-sources

column4: Buyout firm First Atlantic puts Prestolite on sale - sources
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 12 U.S. private equity firm First Atlantic Capital has put engineering company Prestolite Electric Inc up for sale  which could fetch about $400 million  four sources told Reuters.

column4: Mark Machin to retire from Goldman Sachs -memo
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 12 Mark Machin  Goldman Sachs Asia-Pacific ex-Japan vice chairman  is retiring from the firm after 20 years  according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday.

column4: Market Chatter -- Corporate finance press digest
column5: Dec 12 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Monday:

column4: Harley COO: Bikes will get more "accessible " remain American
column5: Harley Davidson Inc's  chief operating officer Matt Levatich said the company will offer motorbikes that are more "physically and financially accessible" to buyers both in the United States and abroad  but it will continue to keep its manufacturing operations almost entirely in the country.

column4: India's Infosys wins multi-year contract from Syngenta
column5: MUMBAI  Dec 12 Infosys Ltd  India's No.2 software services exporter  said on Monday it has won a multi-year transformation and business information technology services contract from Swiss agribusiness major Syngenta AG.

column4: FTC approves Valeant buy with asset sales
column5: WASHINGTON Antitrust regulators approved Valeant Pharmaceutical's  acquisition of the dermatology units of Sanofi and Johnson & Johnson  on the condition that it sell the rights to three prescription drugs  the Federal Trade Commission said on Monday.

column4: US trustee objects to Lehman's hiring of Gleacher for Archstone deal
column5: Dec 12 Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc's  unsecured creditors and a trustee questioned the bankrupt broker-dealer's move to hire Gleacher & Co as a financial adviser for an Archstone deal  as the company already has an adviser in place for any deal.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Newspaper group Lee Enterprises files for bankruptcy
column5: Dec 12 Lee Enterprises Inc  which publishes 48 daily newspapers including St. Louis Post-Dispatch  filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to refinance nearly $1 billion in debt  as newspapers struggle with falling advertisement dollars and dwindling readership.

column4: UPDATE 1-Newspaper group Lee Enterprises files for bankruptcy
column5: Dec 12 Lee Enterprises Inc  which publishes 48 daily newspapers including St. Louis Post-Dispatch  filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to slash its debt load  as newspapers struggle with falling advertisement dollars and dwindling readership.

column4: Japan set to pick Lockheed Martin's F-35 jet -media
column5: TOKYO  Dec 13 Japan is set to pick Lockheed Martin's F-35 fighter jets to replace its ageing fleet of F-4 Phantom fighters  the Yomiuri newspaper reported on Tuesday  reaffirming its security ties with the United States and showing resolve not to be outdone by China's stealth fighter development.

column4: EU lifts deadline on Google  Motorola Mobility deal
column5: BRUSSELS  Dec 12 EU regulators have suspended a Jan. 10 deadline for a decision on Google's  bid to buy U.S. handset maker Motorola Mobility as it waits for the Internet search giant to provide more information on the deal.

column4: Martin Marietta makes $4.8 billion bid for Vulcan
column5: NEW YORK Martin Marietta Materials Inc  launched a hostile $4.8 billion all-stock offer to buy larger rival Vulcan Materials Co  in a bid to build the world's largest producer of sand  gravel and other construction materials.

column4: UPDATE 3-Martin Marietta makes $5 bln bid for Vulcan
column5: * Deal values Vulcan at $36.69 per share  a 9 pct premium

column4: CORRECTED - UPDATE 1-Martin Marietta makes $4.6 bln bid for Vulcan
column5: Dec 12 Martin Marietta Materials Inc on Monday made an unsolicited offer to buy rival Vulcan Materials Co for $4.6 billion in stock.

column4: Medtronic settles probe over doctor kickbacks
column5: WASHINGTON Medtronic Inc has agreed to pay $23.5 million to settle allegations that it paid kickbacks to doctors to encourage them to use its pacemakers and defibrillators  the U.S. Justice Department said on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-Moody's on Origin Energy's announcement on additional gas sales to Sinopec
column5: * Moody's comments on Origin Energy's announcement on additional gas sales to Sinopec

column5: Dec 12 Oshkosh Corp said Carl Icahn is "pursuing his own personal agenda" by nominating a slate of directors to truck maker's board  and urged shareholders to reject the activist investor's proposals.

column4: Oshkosh resists Icahn move  writes to shareholders
column5: Oshkosh Corp  said Carl Icahn is only "pursuing his own personal agenda" with his 10 percent stake in the company  days after the billionaire investor repeated his proposal seeking to merge the specialty truck maker with Navistar .

column4: MBDA buys Northrop's Viper Strike arms unit
column5: PARIS  Dec 12 European missile maker MBDA said on Monday it had bought the Viper Strike munitions business from Northrop Grumman in what its officials described as the first European acquisition of a fully-fledged guided weapon system in the United States.

column5: LONDON The London Stock Exchange  is buying British publisher Pearson's  50 percent stake in FTSE International for 450 million pounds ($703 million) to take full control of the index firm and ramp up its derivatives business.

column5: LONDON  Dec 12 The London Stock Exchange  is buying British publisher Pearson's 50 percent stake in FTSE International for 450 million pounds ($703 million) to take full control of the index firm and ramp up its derivatives business.

column4: Pfizer names Read chairman  OKs $10 billion in buybacks
column5: NEW YORK Pfizer Inc   the world's biggest drugmaker  named Chief Executive Ian Read to the additional post of chairman and authorized buying back company stock for up to $10 billion.

column4: UPDATE 1-Gran Tierra CFO on medical leave
